name: Infested Planet
description: Command a team of 5 elite soldiers against an alien horde of 100,000. Surrounded on all sides, you must outmaneuver and outsmart the enemy.
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP or later Processor:2.2 GHz Memory:1 GB RAM Graphics:256MB OpenGL 2.1 Compartible Hard Drive:300 MB HD space
recommended_requirements: Processor:2.4 GHz Quad Core Memory:4 GB RAM Graphics:1024MB OpenGL 2.1 Compartible

reviews.review_text: Regularly expanding via patches, Infested Planet provides a solid gameplay experience with enough variety to keep you coming back for more. A fine balance between powerful upgrades and being hopelessly outnumbered allows for a fun mixture of a power trip with a slap in the face of miserable failure. If you're like me, you find much enjoyment out of games that bring that feeling. Highly recommended for fans of Tower Defense, Squad Based, and Tactical games.

Infested Planet is a hectic horde RTS title that matches a handful of marines with thousands of bugs and mutated nasties, overwhelming battles will remind you of Starship Troopers' scenes where death and retreat are inescapable.   All missions start with one or more base and a team of marines, with slightly varying goals in the campaign, which ultimately require the capture of all remaining bases and/or destruction of all alien hives. Variety is lacking, but the constant tide of aliens vs your rag-tag team of marines will keep you on the edge, inching slowly towards full domination.  Sound and music are serviceable, graphics are bright and clean, albeit a bit too monotone and can make spotting your troops a bit of a challenge (especially with some overhanging cliffs textures). There is enough structures and technology to keep you engaged in random missions and skirmishes, but not enough depth of strategy to warrant investing more than a few hours after finishing the main campaign.   Good fun for tough RTS fans but implementing multiplayer with a hive faction DLC would make this a solid title! 3.5/5

Great game that I thoroughly enjoyed completing.  I want to address some of the negative comments. Most peoples problems boil down to them not having worked out how to play the game properly. By the sounds of it, the extent of their strategy is deciding do I build 7 shotgunners, or 5 flamers, and then do I attack this point or that point. No wonder they can't complete the later levels.  This game requires constant 'recycling', and effective use of the limited resources. You need to do things like recycle old turrets and advance them forward, or turn your soldiers into snipers to take out the turrets, and then quickly switch them to flamours to rush in.  Sometimes you have to let some of your bases get captured, so you can focus on capturing the enemies in a specific pattern. For example, allow a base that is being attacked from 3 directions to be captured, so you can work your way down 1 of these of these directions, then return to your original base and only have to fend off aliens in 2 directions.  To claim this game lacks in strategies is absurd. The aliens will constantly beat you and cap your bases, so it is regularly 2 steps forward, 1 step back. If you can't handle 'losing for the greater good', then this game might not be for you.  Saying this though, the full price does seem a bit steep, and I did get on special.

Infested Planet   is a good RTS with taste of tower defense, made by Rocket Bear Games in 2014!  Pros  + Really nice graphics + A lot of soldiers (Snipers,officers,etc) + Achievements + Some good modes to play with  + Steam trading cards! + Amazing music + Fantastic tactics + Upgrades to your soldiers + Lots of aliens!  Cons NONE

Love this game! It's so well made. A neat idea well executed and well presented. I love the current trend for 'survival' games and 'walking simulator', but sometimes it's just good to have a game with the immediacy and pace of Invested Planet.   In my opinion this is one of the BEST games of 2014!

The first time I heard about this game was from this  youtuber's review  and also watching his LP (Let's Play) video and I was just hooked enough to get the game.   It's a Top down strategy game where you control a few armies against swarm of aliens trying to eliminate one of their hive after the other.   Simple concept but it has a lot to offer for an indie game.   Every time you advance things get a bit tougher because of the alien mutations plus they sometimes went on a rampage at some point of the game each time you destroy one of their hives. But not only that. Since they're scattered across the map, they tend to re-capture undefended base and turn them back as hives. So there's a lot of micromanaging going on. Sure a few missions are manageable but as you progress, the game will encourage or even unleash your hidden strategic think-tank that's been cooped inside the core of your head for a long time and you don’t have a choice or else you'll lose the game.   But not to worry, perks like weapon modifications and support units (air drops, air strikes...etc) are in the game and usable on each mission. However, if you want to use them you have to earn money and to earn money you will have to win a couple of previous missions in order to advance and all that are in the game with no microtransactions required.   So this game is recommended to those who like RTS (Real Time Strategy) and/or wants to know how it feels like to get swarm by aliens with a few number of units to control like one of those bugs from  Starship Troopers  [www.imdb.com]     'These are the rules. Everybody fights, nobody quits. If you don't do your job I'll kill you myself. Welcome to the Roughnecks!'  - Rico from the movie. But in the game's case, Aliens will run you over.    Have fun!

9/10. Missing one thing, co-op   good games but can be very very punishing..two hours a mission because the ai would come and fully swarm me. go ahead and buy it, it a good game and alot of tactical thinking, make or break a mission..only wish there was more but i like this game

TLDR: If you're looking for RTS games, it's one of the best.  Did not expect the game to be this great!  Unlike most RTS games I've played, EVERY unit here feels valuable!  The AI is really cool. Here's one of the reasons why: For example, I have a team of five, one of them is a sniper. The sniper knows what he's there for, which is taking out small spawning pods and turrets. So, when I send the entire team to attack a hive, the sniper seems to prioritize the targets more suited for him.  You could also take control of each unit individually and micromanage, of course.  On average, each game takes 10-20 mins(at least for me).   Easy to jump into, easy to stop playing. (I'm one of those people who want to play something, open the library, stare at it, and can't decide on what to play, end up closing steam and doing something else <_<. I also easily lose track of time.)  So far, I have only played the game for around 12 hours, and it is already among my top 5 favorites.

I had been eyeing this game for a long time; it looked like a lot of fun but I was a bit put away by the cost. When I finally saw it was on sale, I got the Deluxe Edition right away.  Oh boy, it is fun!  I think the closest comparison to how this game feels is the film Starship Troopers. The core of the game is as follows: on each randomly generated map, there are several capture points. One of them is yours, and the rest are the aliens'. You have to send your small team of marines to capture these points. However, there is a hive to destroy on each one, protected by automated defenses, not to mention the ENDLESS stream of bugs that will go after you. By capturing points and collecting some crates spread around the map you get resources that you can spend on more marines (dead ones respawn), new weapons for your marines, turrets, robot medics, global abilities and more. However, since these resources are limited, you will have to decide and eventually recycle your buys because...  ... the aliens aren't static either. For each point you capture, they will get a permanent mutation according to your strategies. For example, using flamethrowers might cause their poison turrets to have a knockback effect, or have a much longer range. Their hives might start to spit acid themselves. Their critters and spawners might enter frenzy mode after you capture a point. They might start to spawn hardened critters, living bombs or even clones of your marines! As the aliens adapt, you'll have to adapt as well, by recycling upgrades (for 100% of their cost) and reconsidering your strategy. There are a lot of mutations and upgrades, so the game never gets old.   The game has a campaign, random skirmishes and 'weekly challenges' where you compete with other players for a place on the leaderboard. The campaign is quite varied, and serves both as an introduction and as a way to play special missions, like escorting a convoy or testing a new lifeform. You'll earn credits by completing these increasingly difficult missions, which you can spend on unlocking all these cool upgrades for your marines (I guess in Skirmish mode all of these upgrades are already unlocked). The story is cliché, but enjoyable.  I highly recommend getting the Trickster's Arsenal DLC. It adds new toys for both your marines and the aliens, among other stuff, giving some nice additional variety to an already varied game. If you can, get the Deluxe edition!  I must mention the dev is making another DLC that adds a conquest-like campaing, where you would be capturing regions of the planet via regular missions, and unlocking upgrades as in the current story campaign. Since he announced he was working on it on March, I'd say we can expect this new DLC to arrive soon...  Finally, the simplicity of the graphics means it will probably run super smoothly on the vast majority of computers. Units and effects are simple but pretty, and retain a lot of detail if fully zoomed in. It does look and sound nice to me.  Oh, and one can't review this game without mentioning the HUGE bodycount. On the post-mission summary, it's normal to have killed tens of thousands of aliens and having lost tens of marines. A nice reminder of the scale of the battles!  To finish my review: a game that is genuinely fun to play, that will make you think to overcome the AI's reactions to your own strategies, with a lot of ways to play, and space marines vs bugs, plus continued dev support. Do I recommend it? Hell yeah!
First impressions after an hour of play. Its awesome. Great job by the dev. Thank you for crafting this fine experience. Can't wait to play more.
The game has very good game mechanics, an interesting campaign, and a highly configurable skirmish mode. It's one of my current favorites.

Definitely an enjoyable game. Replayability is high and you constantly have to evolve your strategy. At certain levels, the game evolves and gradually gets harder to defeat you. My advice, don't take forever or you will feel the pain.
Awesome game by an awesome developer. Must have for any serious gamer.
Small high-quality game in genre 'swarm control'.
Fast paced and not requiring a lot of time to simply enjoy. Good for short gaming sessions, when you just want simply spent time gaming and not immersing yourself in storyline.

I'm impressed. Deceivingly simple and easy to learn, but beneath it's quite modest comic-like appearance lies a true gem, gruelling and teeth-grinding RTS battle against ever-evolving hordes of sleazy little bug critters from outer space. This is the closest thing of Starship Troopers gone pixels I've witnessed so far. Works well in so many levels - puzzle, troop level tactics, hold your ground, choke point thinking, race against time, scorched earth tactics, retreat and rethink... Good soundtrack is a definite plus.
This is a great game for one-armed men or people with small children. I can put my daughter to sleep with one arm while playing this game with my other arm.
Im enjoying this immensly! I have a sneaking suspition that ill end up sinking as much time into this as I have FTL. And ive put 70+ hours across 3 pcs into that!!!
So far i've played about 7 hours of this game but every hour has been a blast! The gameplay is very simplistic but it is loads of fun controlling small squads around the map killing bug like aliens!

I recommend this squad-based vs hoard game. It's fun to play and the available strategic decisions are well-though out. Do you get more soldiers at an ever-increasing price, give them better weapons or purchase global abilities? The mechanic of giving the aliens new abilities as you capture their points keeps battles interesting all the way through, and the ability to fully recycle resources allows flexibility so you can try different things without getting locked into a hopeless situation. The lower difficulties are enjoyable, and the higher difficulties are challenging, yet possible. A weekly challenge adds a psuedo-social aspect to the game.

A fun top down blast with some minor strategy involved. The Challenge Maps keep it fresh for replayability. It's worth the cost just for the campaign if you want to feel like the commander of some Starship Troopers.

Definetly one of the most refreshing, straight to action, rts out there. No base building, resource gathering, just simple action with upgrade.   A mix between, Doorkickers // breach n clear and the constant aggression from creep world or dont starve.  You must think tactically, but it aint turn based. You must establish a constant defense, but it aint tower defense either... There is no unit bond like Xcomm, instead there are upgrades for more unit weapons and stuff you can build in maps (turrets etc)  I seriously recommend this game for rts fans and people interested in challenging games. This game's difficulty scales amazingly well and its achievements are actually fun to accomplish.

Great tower defense strategy game.  Lots of different types of aliens are coming at you and you need to make a strategy to defeat their bases. Lots of levels and difficulty modes. Gameplay feels nice and responsive, classes are all useful in their own way as are bonuses you can buy. Mutation explanations could be clearer though.
Great combination of Tower Defense and RTS. Highly recommend for fans of either genre.

+ Very addicting  + Good music + Fun and easy to get in + Skirmish mode (endless replay)  - Campaign is short - Music is awesome, but the playlist is very short  The game is very fun, it's a cross between rts and tower defense. Imagine space marines like starcraft / Starship troopers taking on swarms of enemies. However, this is not starcraft or C&C. You have 5 marines (i believe the max is 7 once upgraded). Then when you capture bases or crates, you get points that you can either use to buy weapons for your marines or build defense (Turrets).   Bought it on sale at 75% off, so it's a steal at that price.

Phenomenal game! I discovered Infested Planet from a YouTube video and dropped the few bucks it cost instantly. It's simple; however, that doesn't mean it's easy. It's also addictive as hell. I love the resource management/RTS elements of this game, along with the unique ability to 'trade' in your troops for BP points, which allow construction of buildings, or vice versa, depending on the flow of battle. I'm strongly considering getting the DLC game too. It's like Starship Troopers on crack. A swift testosterone shot in the arm, and a gem every RTS fan should play!
Time for a bug hunt.  Best nods to Starship Troopers I've ever played.

Even if I cannot properly play RTS due to frantic multitasking, I enjoyed the first missions of Infested Planet. It's hard to do a fair review of the game since the pressure was too hard to actually explore all the options the game had to offer (unlike classical TD)  One interesting aspect of the game is that the alien nests have spawn blobs and tower with a visible range, so if you're cautious enough, you may approach your target being undetected (otherwise, a steady flow of critters will converge to you).  Another design aspect of the game is that the alien behavior clearly looks like liquid flow, so it sometimes appears you're dealing with rivers going wild (or plumbing issues). I feel there is some kind of hidden gameplay here, but wasn't able to access it.  All in all : a good RTS if you appreciate being pressured from all sides ;)
This game is great fun, thats all I need to say!
Awesome game. It's very well balanced and keeps the brain working. Very original ... never seen anything like it. I couldn't recommend it more.
Great graphics. Easy to get into. Lots of tech upgrades that add to the destruction.

You initially have lots of strategic options to every mission, and then towards the end you basically have one way to beat things and sometimes even that is more of a chore than anything fun. This game is super awesome! Loved it from first day and now I bought more content for it.   There is a lot of ways to complete some levels. Also some levels felt very hard.

But the game does not punish you too hard if you lose a lot of ground, often you can regroup, recover what you lost and still score a satisfying win in the end. Reminds me a bit of Starship Troopers. Very enjoyable.

Really fun game
This game is extremely fun and very challening. You can pick it up for cheap on a sale even better. We need more games like this.

The randomly generated levels are a treat which makes every battle unique and- often- an impossible fight.  Survive as long as you can.

This game is great fun, and a good way to kill time. Requires a bit of strategy but it isn't very intense. It is sort of short and it can be repeditive nothing really changes but it doesnt really need to be.  I would suggest waiting to get it on sale as it isn't a GREAT 10/10 game that you need now, but I also have no regrets buying it.  The game itself is very simple, and i did not encounter any bugs or glitches but in the later levels if you don't do things very quickly and in a certain way it can be impossible to beat, as the enemies get really powerful buffs that can be smothering. but that is my only real critique of the game.   overall I would give it a 7/10

A wonderful game with a crisp art style and very fulfilling strategy. All of the fun of RTS without any of the resourcing. I highly reccomend you buy this game. I keep coming back to play this over games I paid much more for!
A fun little time waster.
I think this is one of the best games I've ever played. Flawless game design. Bravo.
This game made me curse and scream in anger. It is frustrating and difficult. Im pretty sure the AI cheats and the developers are sadists.  I Love it.

Nice idea, but I'm not that pleased with execution. First levels is like 'I just order to attack', then later levels goes 'just watch how they kill you'. Feels like something is not working... I bought buildings, which should give me healing, granades, turrets... nothing happens. And I have no money to spend on marines, so I walk with common guns, looking out for these granades and healing... but there's nothing. (Most expensive) Minigun guy looks nice, but can't handle wave of enemies. Everything is covered in poison, slowed, so when you choose command to '1 shoot rocket at enemy', EVERY marine is literally DIVING in sea of aliens, because no one has the range to shoot. So you choose to back off, but (poison & attacks) they cant really move. Okay, then simple attack and watch. Auto-attack with basic stuff like on tutorial. Something isn't working... Game is really nice BEFORE you hit medium-late levels, where you should turn into Tibetan monk

Infested Planet is a very entertaining game however there are game impeding technical problems with it. The worst of them is the dead scroll keys at random times. Specifically, randomly in the middle of the mission, the game would refuse to let the player move up or down, thus making the game impossible to play. Also, the game would sometimes lag probably due to too many enemies spawned. This should not be happening with this type of game at this level of graphics. Optimization in the code is needed.

Very satisfying flash game style RTS. Elegant resource control and difficulty ramp throughout the game. Slightly pricy for the play time but makes up with polish. Excellent game overall.

The game is extremely well balanced. Like REALLY WELL balanced. This is by far it's biggest strength.  A great 30-40 min per session game.  Lots of violence, lots of guns but with some definite tactics.  You control a squad space marines against an alien threat. Each marine is more than a match for each alien, however there are hundreds of aliens - and only 5 of you!  The AI is reasonably intelligent and changes it fronts of attack in a 'this makes sense' kinda way.  If you want a game to quickly switch off from the world for 30 mins at a time this is a definite purchase.   I reckon it is good for 20 odd hours of relaxing gameplay.

This is a pretty awesome little realtime strategy game. The capture-and-hold elements along with various upgrades have kept it interesting while the constantly-overwhelming-feeling gameplay has stayed entertaining.

This is going to be a true and honest review for anyone looking to buy this game.  Personal Raiting: Must buy for tower defense lovers.  On a scale of 1-10: This game is a 9.5 personally it is a very hard game. You see so many easy tower defense games but this is so easy level 1-5 but later your going to have a pain with this but totally worth time spending and coming up with a good plan.  Genre: Tower Defense and Strategy.  When to buy: Well a sale is great but 15$ for this game is honestly worth it completely :)  Now for a personal review: First I wanted to say that this game is very good but i still have yet to beat everything cause it is quite hard. There are trading cards and achievments for those certain people and the achievments are easy to get for the most part though. But back to the game itself you look at this and it look slike an FPS but then you actual play the game and your like woah wait what am I playing. So you have a squad of 4 men who are able to be upgraded into differnt classes and you are able to build stations to improve your bases quality. So your goal is to take your squad and invade aliens bases. Over time the aliens gain perks which are very annoying for the most part which makes this part of the game the planning part. For most story missions there are set levels where you have to play on but there are also side quests where every time you do it the level is randomly generated which is also another plus. So you take over bases build turrets and you have this thing called BP which is pretty much how you upgrade things and your squad of 4 may be increased using BP. You may also redo any missions to gain more money for perks. Some perks last forever and some are a one time mission only. Now for the two side quests you may do. There are two types the first type is command and conquer and the second part is time limit destruction. In command and conquer you must pretty much take over evrey base you see, you have infinite time but let me warn you as they will gain perks the longer you play. There are 3 majoy difficulties which are where the achievments come in. Now for time limit destruction you must destroy all of the bases within a time limit. For every base you destroy you gain more time. This also has 3 majoy difficulties just like command and conquer. So overall this game is worth getting for anybody you can grasp the concept easily you might rage later on but you won't regret this buy :)!!!!!!!!

Pretty enjoyable game if you like to micromanage troops but not base build.  The difficulty swings wildly at points but its never difficult, rather it seems to range from easy to somewhat hard.  Once you figure out a build you like you can basically get away with using that build over and over.  The game also lets you replay old levels to gain more points to level up/buy equipment.   Every time you play a level it will be slightly different (with some levels being completely different each play through)  Honestly I rather enjoyed it and it has high replay value.  No multiplayer is a bit of a bummer but no big deal.
One of the best tactic TD

there's not much that is more satisfying than lobbing a grenade at a blue-green crowd of writhing aliens and watching your fps drop 30 frames as a red cloud fills an entire portion of your screen  I rate starship troopers out of aliens
Short campaign, some fun skirmish stuff... get it on sale and you ll get yourself about 10-20 hours of pure enjoyment. It does what it is meant to do well!
Seperbly simple and satisfying. Brilliantly realised.

GREAT game, especially for the price, easy to pick up and play, fun upgrades and missions allow you to take it however you want, if you want a small elite squad with upgraded roles go for it, if you want a large force of regular grunts, you can asswell, or have a few guys running around building turrets and mechanically fight your way to victory! Oh lord get this game!!!

I highly recommend this game. There is a short, generic story by means of dialogue windows to go along with it that serves its purpose to move from one mission to the next. The reason this game is great though is because of the gameplay. I feel that the player and the enemy are very well matched and the mechanic for capturing points with your squad (or other mission objectives) to build up your squad is rewarding. In addition, I found that the Attack+Move command works intelligently (e.g. snipers/scouts will target towers/buildings among the horde of enemies so there is no need to micromanage when things get crazy). The variety of weapons/technologies and enemy types is more than enough to keep the game interesting and allow for multiple strategies. In the Campaign section there are multiple types of games too (standard, raid, hunt, etc.) that will shift your strategies.  I am most impressed with the Endgame content. I felt the acheivements were adequately challenging yet fair. In addition to the Campaign, there is a Skirmish mode and a set of Weekly challenges (with a leaderboard). The Skirmish mode is basically a map generator with all sorts of customization. The only thing I would ask for from the Skirmish mode is the ability to increase the rate of growth of the enemy past the current capping point.   Otherwise, for the asking price, this is a great game.

What I liked:      Very hard strategy game with lots of replayability     Custom skirmishes     So many fun ways to beat missions   What You Need to Know:      This game towards the end can get super hard (especially side mission)     Kinda a hybrid between Tower Defence and RTS     Can't think of anything negative or annoying    My Score:
A very nice game, will last you a couple hours

Really good game. I killed many bugs in a span of 30 minutes, and they get harder to kill and outsmart over time. The developers have really hit the nail on the head with this game. It's challenging, unfair at times, but that's how a strategy game should be. You need to understand when to make a retreat and when to push, or your decisions will take a turn for the worst. Overall, I would recommend this game, especially when it's on sale. Also, purchase the DLC. It adds to the game.
Fun game. Buy it if you enjoy micromanaging

Fantastic fun and worth every penny, looking forward to an expansion/sequel? :)  I completed the campaign over the course of a couple of days but don't let that put you off. There is plenty of replayability in the skirmish mode and even the odd random campaign mission.  Would have liked to see a multiplayer as coop would be a blast!
Holy wow this game sucked me in for all the hours ever..

good little game well worth a few quid for 10 hours campaign !
Simple form, great content.

I have played this game for quite a while and I have enjoyed it a lot. I will start with a simple list: +Good graphics +Very fun gameplay, it take quite a bit of micro-managment +Very satisfying, there is something that feels so good about killing thousands of aliens. +Has a good difficulty, not to easy, not to hard  -No multiplayer (Yet this game feels perfect for it) -It is rather repetitive -The game lacks replay value -The campaign is rather short  So for the graphics, what can I say? They are alright. AAA titles will put it to shame, but graphics mean little in a game unless they are downright horrible or put strain on performence. Because the aliens tend to attack on multiple fronts and resources are limited, you have to choose what the spend it on carefully and arranges your troops well. Will you send your entire squad to take down a group of hives and risk losing a point? Or will you split you team up and chance it? Wil you split you team up and back up your assault with heli strikes? There are plenty of options. The difficulty isn't to bad, though not to easy either. (Unless you spam seige cannons) Occasionally there will be that ONE factor that screws you such as losing a support building or a tower spawner messing up your base. The mutations also add a whole layer of depth into the game. There are 33 different mutations that buff the enemy when you take a hive. Basically, the closer you get to winning, the harder it becomes.  Now on the bad side, the game doesn't have multiplayer. This game feels perfect for it though. You can have a marine commander pitted against an alien commander and they try to beat each other. The alien commander could draw paths for the alien swarm to follow and unlock new mutations, hives, and build turrets. This could even go a step further and allow a few other players to play as hero units General Magusson, The doctor, or drake where they move around, shoot weapons with crosshairs, and throw grenades at the cost of ammo. That would cater to the more action players while the RTS players play as the commander above them.  The gameplay gets rather repetitve during long play sessions. This is because most missions are pretty much 'Capture the points' or 'Kill all the hives' The campaign puts some variation into the missions, such as convoy, supply recovery, etc. Overall the game needs a few more modes. After the campaign is over, the game lacks replay value, there just isn't some kinds of in-game acheivment system or secret unlocks. It just makes you lose intrest. You can still make highly customizable skirmish modes and do daily challenges though, so that is addition content if you feel the desire to play them. It took me about 10 hours to beat the campaign, and that manages to defeat most AAA games. I just feel that the game could use more story content and a better story. (The story is basically 'Kill all the aliens')   To summerize, the game has weak replay value, no multiplayer, and a weak story. The gameplay is solid the graphics have their charms and the feeling of killing thousands of aliens as well as the metagame make this very fun to play. I rate this game a 10$/60$ (Rating by money, how unorthodox) When this game is on sale it will have massive value to it. You can buy it at full price if you have money to burn. This is a great game while it lasts, if this game has a good multiplayer added I would bump the rating up the 15$/60$. This is rocket Bear studios first project and I can definitly see more great stuff coming from them. This game earns at least 10 dollers of you money in it's current state.
Fun, fast and furious.

Excellent 2D squad-based RTS. While the movement may initially seem slow, building officers remedies that and makes the gameplay a lot quicker. Highly recommended.
Fantastic game. Much more fun than solitare for a quick blast.

WIthin my relatively short time playing I have found myself seriously enjoying this title. Though the visuals aren't exactly top-notch, the gameplay itself is quite visceral. The way you destroy huge groups of endless alien creatures is well done. Using the equipment you develop feels like it is actually useful and trying to use what resources you have effectively is challenging but far from impossible. The difficulty both from scenario to scenario as well as within each piece is reasonably well-done. If I was to criticise this game for anything it would be that there isn't the ability to hotkey squads like in a standard RTS so you have to be a bit more careful about splitting your troops up, but most of the time you bundle up and attack move anyway. This leads to a bit of potential oversimplicity for some, although I like the straightforward nature of the game.  Overall an enjoyable experience and well worth it having picked it up while it was on sale.

My score: 9/10  An enjoyable RTS. It's kind of like playing Starcraft against the zerg. I appreciate that there are different strategies that you can play, and there is no one set way of playing the game 'right.' The AI mutates, which means you have to change your strategy on the fly, and you are able to do so because you can change character class, and buildings on the spot. The game is fast-paced, and there's no resource collecting.  Some problems with the game though is that it can be rubber-bandy. You take over one spot and another one gets taken over. You retake it, and the enemy regroups somewhere else... Another problem is that the 'tidying up' phase can be a bit drawn out. Not so bad that you're looking for one peasant hiding somewhere in the fog of war, but there's a point when you can say: 'I won already, c'mon...'  Pros: Various strategies work equally well. Fast-paced. Good variety of buildings and character classes. Feels good gunning down waves of aliens. No grinding or other time-consuming activities.  Cons: The game is a bit short. But it has decent replay value. Graphics could be better. Controls are not as precise, or snappy as I would've liked.  Excellent game, worthy of it's price tag, and an even better deal if on sale.

Other than that,  Would kill 20k bugs in 10 minutes again. 10/10

One of the most fun games that I own.  I play Infested Planet a couple times every week. I have played through the story mode several times and will probably do so again. The weekly challenges give me all the reason I need to keep on coming back for more. And now there is a campaing mode (sorta like Risk) which is just excellent!  The tactical combat is incredibly satisfying. The way you have to adapt to the ever evolving enemies makes for some of the best squad based combat I have ever played. There are so many interesting combinations of units, reasearch and tech you can build... I am still discovering new ways to win.  Infested Planet has been updated and improved so many times I have lost count. It is years old and still the developer is still showing love for this unique gem of a game.  I cannot recommend Infested Planet strongly enough.
Great top down RTS/Tower Defence Starship Troopers type game, loads of alien bugs to eliminate and upgrades make for a well addictive game.

Infested Planet is strategy game from independent developer Rocket Bear Games. Take charge of 5 veteran soldiers and fight an alien army of 100,000. It's all about striking hard and killing lots of squishy alien bugs. To do this, you get an arsenal of awesome weapons; from walking tanks with miniguns to field artillery, you're set to kick the aliens back down their slimy hole.   Infested Planet is a deep strategy game, with plenty of replay value. The game comes with a random map generator, allowing you to play in a new place whenever you want. The aliens themselves mutate unpredictably, and you have to stay on your toes to defeat them. Flex your strategic mind and outsmart the alien menace.

This game is a hidden gem. The random mutations on the enemies every time you capture a hive keep the game interesting as you progress in each scenario. At the time of this review it is currently on sale for a steal. Just get it.
Great game, time just flies by!

Absolutely love this game. Did not understand the concept even after reading a couple of Reviews but after about 2 min of playing everything becomes clear. From there you get a Mix of Strategy and Tower defense. What is awesome is that the mutations really change up the game to the point that one strategy will not work consistently throughout the game or throughout the mission. It is the first game where I have really found myself painted into a corner barely holding on testing multiple different strategies just to be able to push them back. It also flips fast where you think you will have them beat and then in seconds everything crumbles and you are falling back trying to contain them. Great game. Hopefully they keep expanding it

I've enjoyed this game but I've noticed that a single map can range from easy to impossible very quickly depending on a number of uncontrollable things. There are certain weapons and structures that make winning significantly easier and there are certain mutations that make winning almost impossible.  Getting the wrong combination can turn any game into an un-winnable stalemate. I've rarely lose a game but there have been a number of games where we reach an impasse because I don't have the tools I need to win and they can't break my defenses. Maybe that speaks to my lack of skills but it does make the game a bit frustrating because I know I need to reroll the scenario and hope for a better combination.  I like the game; just realize that this is a game meant to be played, not to be beaten.
